010package imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
013import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
014import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
015import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
016import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
017
018/**
019 * This class represents an arbitrary linear transformation in 2D.
020 * Instances of this class and any subclass are immutable.
021 */
022public class LinearMapping2D implements Mapping2D {
023        
024        protected final double 
025                a00, a01, a02,
026                a10, a11, a12,
027                a20, a21, a22;
028
029        //  constructors -----------------------------------------------------
030        
031        /**
032         * Creates a new identity mapping.
033         */
034        public LinearMapping2D() {
035                a00 = 1; a01 = 0; a02 = 0;
036                a10 = 0; a11 = 1; a12 = 0;
037                a20 = 0; a21 = 0; a22 = 1;
038        }
039        
040        /**
041         * Creates a linear mapping from a transformation matrix
042         * of arbitrary size (may be even empty). The actual transformation 
043         * matrix is formed by inserting the given matrix into
044         * a 3x3 identity matrix starting at position (0,0).
045         * 
046         * @param A a matrix of arbitrary size
047         */
048        public LinearMapping2D(double[][] A) {
049                double[][] M = extractLinearMatrix(A);
050                a00 = M[0][0]; a01 = M[0][1]; a02 = M[0][2];
051                a10 = M[1][0]; a11 = M[1][1]; a12 = M[1][2];
052                a20 = M[2][0]; a21 = M[2][1]; a22 = M[2][2];
053        }
054        
055        /**
056         * Inserts the given matrix into a new 3x3 identity matrix,
057         * starting at element (0,0). All elements outside
058         * 3x3 are ignored. If the matrix is 
059         * 
060         * @param A the original matrix
061         * @return a 3x3 matrix
062         */
063        private static double[][] extractLinearMatrix(double[][] A) {
064                double[][] M = Matrix.idMatrix(3);
065                final int m = Math.min(3, A.length);    // max. 3 rows
066                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
067                        final int n = Math.min(3, A[i].length); // max. 3 columns
068                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
069                                M[i][j] = A[i][j];
070                        }
071                }
072                return M;
073        }
074
075        /**
076         * Creates an arbitrary linear mapping from the specified matrix elements.
077         * @param a00 matrix element A_00
078         * @param a01 matrix element A_01
079         * @param a02 matrix element A_02
080         * @param a10 matrix element A_10
081         * @param a11 matrix element A_11
082         * @param a12 matrix element A_12
083         * @param a20 matrix element A_20
084         * @param a21 matrix element A_21
085         * @param a22 matrix element A_22
086         */
087        public LinearMapping2D (
088                        double a00, double a01, double a02, 
089                        double a10, double a11, double a12,
090                        double a20, double a21, double a22) {
091                this.a00 = a00;  this.a01 = a01;  this.a02 = a02;
092                this.a10 = a10;  this.a11 = a11;  this.a12 = a12;
093                this.a20 = a20;  this.a21 = a21;  this.a22 = a22;
094        }
095        
096        /**
097         * Creates a new linear mapping from an existing linear mapping.
098         * @param lm a given linear mapping
099         */
100        public LinearMapping2D (LinearMapping2D lm) {
101                this(lm.getTransformationMatrix());
102        }
103        
104        // ----------------------------------------------------------
105        
106        /**
107         * Scales the transformation matrix such that a22 becomes 1.
108         * Any linear mapping can be normalized and thereby be converted to
109         * a projective mapping (see {@link ProjectiveMapping2D}.
110         * @return the normalized linear mapping (i.e., a projective mapping)
111         */
112        public ProjectiveMapping2D normalize() {
113                if (Arithmetic.isZero(Math.abs(a22))) {
114                        throw new ArithmeticException("Zero value in a22, cannot normalize linear mapping!");
115                }
116                double b00 = a00/a22;   double b01 = a01/a22;   double b02 = a02/a22;
117                double b10 = a10/a22;   double b11 = a11/a22;   double b12 = a12/a22;
118                double b20 = a20/a22;   double b21 = a21/a22;
119                return new ProjectiveMapping2D(b00, b01, b02, b10, b11, b12, b20, b21);
120        }
121        
122        // ----------------------------------------------------------
123        
124        @Override
125        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d pnt) {
126                final double x = pnt.getX();
127                final double y = pnt.getY();
128                double h =  (a20 * x + a21 * y + a22);
129                double x1 = (a00 * x + a01 * y + a02) / h;
130                double y1 = (a10 * x + a11 * y + a12) / h;
131                return PntDouble.from(x1, y1);
132        }
133        
134        /**
135         * Calculates and returns the inverse mapping.
136         */
137        @Override
138        public LinearMapping2D getInverse() {
139                // System.out.println("LinearMapping getInverse()");
140                double[][] ai = Matrix.inverse(this.getTransformationMatrix());
141                return new LinearMapping2D(ai);
142        }
143        
144        /**
145         * Concatenates this mapping A with another linear mapping B and returns
146         * a new mapping C, such that C(x) = B(A(x)).
147         * @param B the second mapping
148         * @return the concatenated mapping
149         */
150        public LinearMapping2D concat(LinearMapping2D B) {
151                double[][] C = Matrix.multiply(B.getTransformationMatrix(), this.getTransformationMatrix());
152                return new LinearMapping2D(C);
153        }
154        
155        /**
156         * Concatenates a sequence of linear mappings AA = (A1, A2, ..., An), with
157         * the result A(x) = A1(A2(...(An(x))...)). Thus, the mapping
158         * An is applied first and A1 last, with the associated transformation
159         * matrix a = a1 * a2 * ... * an.
160         * If AA is empty, the identity mapping is returned.
161         * If AA contains only a single mapping, a copy of this mapping is returned.
162         * 
163         * @param AA a (possibly empty) sequence of linear transformations
164         * @return the concatenated linear transformation 
165         */
166        public static LinearMapping2D concatenate(LinearMapping2D... AA) {
167                if (AA.length == 0) {
168                        return new LinearMapping2D();   // identity
169                }
170                else {
171                        double[][] a = AA[0].getTransformationMatrix();
172                        for (int i = 1; i < AA.length; i++) {
173                                a = Matrix.multiply(a, AA[i].getTransformationMatrix());
174                        }
175                        return new LinearMapping2D(a);
176                }
177        }
178        
179        /**
180         * Retrieves the transformation matrix for this mapping.
181         * @return the 3x3 transformation matrix
182         */
183        public double[][] getTransformationMatrix() {
184                return new double[][]
185                                {{a00, a01, a02},
186                                 {a10, a11, a12},
187                                 {a20, a21, a22}};
188        }
189
190        /**
191         * Returns a copy of this mapping.
192         * @return a new mapping of the same type
193         */
194        public LinearMapping2D duplicate() {
195                return new LinearMapping2D(this);
196        }
197
198        public String toString() {
199                return Matrix.toString(getTransformationMatrix());
200        }
201        
202        // -----------------------------------------------------------
203        
204//      /**
205//       * For testing only.
206//       * @param args ignored
207//       */

213//                              {-0.307692, 0.230769, 1.000000}};
214//              System.out.println("A = " + Matrix.toString(A));
215//              
216//              double[][] Ai = Matrix.inverse(A);
217//              System.out.println("Ai = " + Matrix.toString(Ai));
218//              
219//              double[][] I = Matrix.multiply(A, Ai);
220//              System.out.println("\ntest: should be the  identity matrix: = \n" + Matrix.toString(I));
221//              
222//              ProjectiveMapping2D pA = (new LinearMapping2D(A)).normalize();
223//              System.out.println("mapping pA = \n" + pA.toString());
224//              
225//              ProjectiveMapping2D AA1 = pA.concat(pA);
226//              System.out.println("mapping AA1 = \n" + AA1.toString());
227//              
228//              ProjectiveMapping2D AA2 = LinearMapping2D.concatenate(pA, pA).normalize();
229//              System.out.println("mapping AA1 = \n" + AA2.toString());
230//      }
231
232
233        
234}
235
